author: Kindle Customer
title: Good, even great case. Just got a few quirks...
body: I chose to buy the custom image option for the Fire HDX 8.9 because Amazon does not currently carry that size case in a color I was interested in. So far I have found that the case itself is very well made and seemes to be sturdy with the potential to be nice and long lasting. The magnets are strong and the origami cover/stand is easy to get used to and use. So all good there.Now to discuss the custom image: I am afraid that I have to deduct a star for the image. Let it be known that the vibrant, colorful, and sharp images displayed to entice you to purchase this item are very little like what is printed on the case. The colors are muted and all edges between them are blurred slightly. I realize that some disparity between advertised images and actual product is to be expected, but I had not expected the discrepancy to be so large. The image I had chosen was both detailed and dark and I'm afraid much of the detail has been lost into the surrounding darkness. Not to say that the picture is unattractive, I still like it and think it's pretty, but losing some of those details is rather disappointing. Hence the deducted star.Should you wish to have a custom case made, my advice would be to choose a very bright, sharp image with the understanding that some of that will be lost or else choose something modern-art-ish that won't matter if some of the colors and details blur together.All in all, I like my new case and would probably buy another one should I need to.

author: Lydia J.
title: It's ok, but could be a bit better
body: My custom case arrived today on time. The idea is great and seems straight forward, but there are a few quirks that I'm sure will be improved upon in time. First, you can't put a back and front image on the case, only one side or the other. When designing the case, the preview doesn't match the thumbnail of the final image, so pay attention to the final thumbnail when you're actually placing your image to make sure that parts and pieces don't get cut off inappropriately by the fold gutters if putting your image on the front.I got this as a gift for someone because I couldn't find a Kindle case in the color they would've wanted, let alone one that is more resistant to drops and spills and is still decorative. They will probably be happy very happy with it, however, I submitted a print quality, high resolution image and it still looks pretty washed out compared to what I saw on my monitor in Photoshop. That's the main reason I am giving this product 3 stars, but I would actually give it 3.5. But considering the cost, you can't keep making tweaks to over exaggerate the color to work around that possible production issue. Mine is not the only comment like this, so it must be their application process that washes out the image. The image was put onto the case in a way that it is apart of the case and looks like it will wear well and not peel off under average circumstances. In terms of the case itself, the magnetics are strong, but I wish that the well to hold the Kindle was a bit more secure. This case is very thin and lightweight and really is just more of a decorative cover, stronger than a cloth or fake leather sleeve; so I would still be careful about how you handle you Kindle and avoid dropping it.

author: Russell David Phillips
title: And the ability to customize the cover is awesome. Because of the origami folding thing you will ...
body: PROS: This is a decent case, the image printing worked as advertised, etc...  And the ability to customize the cover is awesome.  Because of the origami folding thing you will have black bands across the image so plan your image accordingly.NEUTRAL:Origami Stand: The whole origami folding cover thing to provide a stand is interesting but there are pros and cons and in the end it's a bit of a wash.  It is more interesting looking but since the cover folds in a couple of ways when you open from a corner like half the cover will open and there can be a little fumbling to flip the cover over. VERY minor really but there are other cases with stands that work as well so It's not like it seems to add anything.  That plus the bands across cover criss cross your image limits your image choices.  And finally like every other stand out there its always at an angle that is best viewed with it on your desk and you sit in a chair looking at it.  I really want one which could be nearly upright but no luck.  Again this is all neutral in the end.CONS:Bit Heavy: For my taste the case is a bit clunky.  There is a significant difference between the bare tablet and the tablet in the case.Magnetic Hold: The tablet is held in place by magnets which are strong enough so it stays in place firmly but at the same time I like the  that it doesn't slip out but it can shift very slightly dependent on how you are holding it. When you open the case the cover magnetically attaches to the back to.  It's pretty slick but there is some slight wiggle in the case I believe.  When I watch Netflix in bed at night I occasionally experience the volume suddenly going to zero.  I believe (but I'm not sure) this is the reason why.  Also because of the magnetic cover attaching to the back the ONLY way you can stand the tablet is in the proscribed manner.  Like I said I prefer a more upright angle but the magnetic attach makes it's not possible even if you don't mind a precarious balance.OVERALL: A solid case, it will protect your kindle and you can customize it.  Most of my issues with it are of a personal taste nature so if the items I have a problem with are something you don't care about then you should consider this a higher rating for you.

author: M. Stewart
title: Excellent case
body: The kindle HDX is very thin and I worried about it getting damaged.  After looking at my options, I decided to order this case.  I picked the stock photo of birch trees with red leaves on a black case.  I must admit I was a little disappointed at how muted the picture was compared to the picture I selected.  But it is still interesting to look at and while the photo option was fun, it was not the main reason for buying the case.  This is a wonderful case that opens easily and closes securely.  The ability to support the kindle in portrait or landscape has been so useful for me.  I would not hesitate to order another one.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love the look and use; I think my particular case has a fitting flaw that isn't general
body: I love how the design turned out (mine--darker than the file, but that was anticipated from the comments and actually added something to the original plan. Unfortunately, my Kindle doesn't snap into it or slide securely in, which I think it's supposed to do. I just haven't had time to enquire about this. Basically, when it's time for me to use the buttons I have to either lift it out or temporarily push it into place (it won't stay). I love the stand (it'll work with it, even though it isn't snapped in--magnet does the trick) and feel it gives good protection.

author: Angel
title: I did the "Create Your Own" Origami Case.
body: I gave it a 4 out of 5 rating. I only marked it down 1 point because it is just a touch heavier than I was expecting it to be, but that may be a good thing. I am very careful with my Kindle Fire HDX 8.9, not because it is delicate or any thing like that, but just because it is my first Kindle. Lol. The Origami case makes it feel very protected and the "Create Your Own" makes it very individual for me. Even though I chose one of the stock pictures...in my small town there is a good chance no one will have one like it. I like that!

author: K. Smith
title: Terrific function, love the personalization
body: Works great. I love the auto on/off and the functionality of the origami. Very lightweight as well. It's true the photos aren't as vibrantly colored as the original photos. Imagine your photos with a bit of black as an undertone. The back photo can be anything, but choose the front photo carefully--it's the one that will fold along the origami lines, so you want to position it with care. It takes longer to receive a personalized cover and it costs a bit more, but it was well worth the extra days of waiting to have something original that I use every day. I love this case.

author: kayakranger
title: Love my Kindle Fire HDX "Create your own" Black Origami case
body: It fits well and I love the "instant on" when opening the case. It also turns it off when I close it.I love that I could customize it with a photo. I tried fitting my own photos in the online displays but my own photos didn't seem to be large enough to look good, so I selected one of their nice designs.  I chose the northern lights design and had it placed on the front and back & it really looks awesome!  And for the same price as the plain black one!  So glad I found this deal!

author: Vicki A. Mills
title: Clever and Unique Cover
body: Creating my own cover was easy, quick, and inexpensive! I used a favorite photo for the cover image and completed it in just a few minutes. This company gave me an excellent product, exactly as advertised. I highly recommend it for anyone who wants a unique cover/stand up case for their Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" device.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Quality Product
body: I ordered this case for my brother with our mother's (she passed away) picture on it.  She loved to read and the picture was of her reading.  My brother loves to read as well, and now he gets to keep our mom close to his heart.  He loves it.  It's a good quality case and the picture came out very nice.

author: T. Arnold
title: Pretty good quality
body: Make sure your photo aligns with the creases.  Get the parts of the photo in the triangles that you care about, like faces.  Otherwise the creases will block parts of the photo.  I made a collage of 4 photos and put one in each triangle.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Created My Own - And Glad Of It.
body: Picked out my own cover for both back and front.  Looks great.  I can now find my KINDLE FIRE HDX  8.9 anywhere.  The folds work great for standing and sitting up.  Great Product.  Originally I wanted red but it was going to take to long so I decided to try the  Create You Own.  Got it in 5 days.

author: camille barnes
title: Did not fit Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.
body: This case did not fit my Kindle HDX 8.9. I didn't even receive it how I ordered it with the customization. I am so very disappointed with this product and have contacted the seller to see what I need to do about replacement. It is a nice case, however not a good fit for the new Kindle Fire HDX 8.9.

author: Margie  Hahn
title: Great customizing of Origami case
body: I received my case in less than a week, Was amazed at  how beautiful my dogs picture turned out for the front cover of my case. The directions on how to customize were very easy to follow no problems at all. This company does excellent work. I would recommend them to everyone that wants a unique case for their Kindle. Now I can immediately tell mine from my friends who also has a black case

author: The Photographer
title: Cool, good looking cover
body: This cover is just the right thing for my new Kindle Fire HDX. It fits just right and looks so good with the picture I chose for it. The picture seems to be engraved in to the cover and is not just a stickon cover. This cover will last the life of the Kindle.

author: Thrysca
title: Custom case picture review
body: Erased old Review writing new one. It been 3 years now and still works perfectly. Case starting to wear on edges but thin piece holding it together perfectly fine. It protected my kindle from so many falls.I hope this works with 4th gen when I get it.

author: Vampire1
title: Vanity case.
body: Put your own pix on this case and announce to others whose it is. Good idea and the case appears to be very serviceable. If you don't mind an extra wait time for setup and delivery, I recommend it as a good buy.

author: a customer
title: Poorly designed
body: While I love the Kindle HD and HDX families, I just received this case and do not like it.  First and foremost, the picture's colors were changed to a dark grey although the picture I uploaded was a good quality warm tone picture.  But I think the part I really do not like is the case itself.  When you put your Kindle HDX 8.9 in there, the tablet falls off constantly.  It is a very heavy case also which defeats the purpose of the lighter tablet.  The case looks almost too big for the Kindle HDX 8.9 and does not hold it all.  Also, if you plan on taking pictures you are out of luck as there are no holes to allow the camera to shoot.  Also, very surprising that there are no speaker space because that is one of the main features Amazon likes to boost about the HDX8.9.  Again, love the tablet but not happy with that case at all.

author: T. THOMAS
title: Create your own origami case good deal
body: I got this for my husband and he loves it. The print is clear and looks good. It gives his tablet enough heft when he's carrying it around. He finds it a bit cumbersome sliding the tablet up the case to take fotos.

author: Kathleen M. Coehrs
title: Good Cover
body: I like this cover, holds my Kindle well. Really don't like the fact that you have to slide the Kindle up to use the back camera. Wish it had a hole for the camera. When I slide it up sometimes my Kindle feels loose, like it's not being held tightly. The picture I used for my cover is not as vivid as the picture I sent in but it still looks good. Overall I am pleased with this cover.

author: D. Craig
title: The case looks nice but doesn't work
body: I ordered a custom case. When it arrived it looks really good, folded nicely, and fit my Fire HDX 8.9. The problem came when I put the device into the case. It started into a reboot cycle and never stopped. I took the Kindle out of the case and it stopped. I understand that since the Fire HDX 8.9 is new and the case, with it's magnets to control the Kindle, is an add-on piece of technology, but you might want to wait a bit before ordering. This is a known issue in the discussion forums.Too bad, because except for the reboot issue (I am trying to send back the case), the case is really nicely made.

author: Judy
title: Not what it should be
body: This cover did not fit my Kindle Fire.  They let me keep it anyway, but I can't use it on anything.

author: Luis Guerra
title: Photo print quality ðŸ˜Ÿ
body: Really pleased with the case.  The Case is great.. It's very functional.  Photo reproduction not very clear...  Kinda of fuzzy..

author: Gand
title: Origami Cover
body: Works fine. A little awkward to take photos with it on since moving it up from the cover is difficult. Otherwise very good.

author: Dana Thomas
title: Cool
body: Really cool to personalize items.  The picture turned out very nice even though the case is a little textured, it didn't really distort the picture much.

author: amy haug
title: love this case
body: Great product would recommend it to anyone. Like it how kindle starts up when opened up. My son dropped it and didn't damage it.

author: SchmeeT
title: Awesome
body: This case is awesome love how it connects magnetically and you only have to slide it up to use the camera. not only that but the picture comes in nice and clear and makes it your very own and unique I love it.

author: eilene belle
title: awesome Origami cover for 8.9 Kindle Fire HDX!!!
body: It is Totally Awesome!! I love the way it turns the kindle on or off,when you open or close it!! And also the way it bends so you can prop it open to watch something!!! Worth every cent!!! ( Get it Customized. That way it is really Unique and no one else probably has it. It is like your signature ,made by you!!)

author: Rlunnen
title: picture cover folding cover
body: Picture I used came out great. I just wished the cover made it easier to use when I am in bed reading before sleep. My old 7 inch kindle cover (a after market cover) had a hole in the middle that I could put my thumb through, otherwise product  is just like they said and works great everywhere else

author: Marilyn Baker
title: Great Deal!
body: Turned out awesome.  I put my favorite St. Louis Blues picture on it because I couldn't find a premade one.  Cost was great.

author: Daniel Espinosa
title: Be careful!!!!
body: I chose 2 different photos and they printed the same one in both sides. Tragedy...it was a gift for someone special and it was uselss like that.

author: constanceserrano
title: It's Okay!
body: It is okay for what it is, Could not get the pictures on like I wanted. Thought would be more red in color. It works

author: stephg1218
title: love my cover.
body: The photo I chose looks perfect.  It is a rose.  The finish is very matted, not glossy at all. Both landscape and portrait angle are not too steep and stands up without sliding or falling over.

author: 420photog
title: Functional case
body: it's awesome , I love it . looks good , protects kindle and my business logo across the front to boot .

author: Chef Chelette
title: Origami Case
body: Crap-o-la

author: Randy Fletcher
title: with the black case,
body: with the black case, the image was dark I should have done a little photoshop before sending to brighten the image

author: cincydon
title: Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" Black Origami Case
body: It makes a perfect pair to the Kindle. The picture is perfect and the case fits like a glove. It was shipped the same day and was here in a couple of more days. The case is made well and seems to be very sturdy. I'm sure my wife is going to enjoy this case for years to come when she opens it Christmas morning.

author: Dianne Eslinger
title: Love It!
body: I love my Origami Case. My Kindle is protected, I have my very own chosen picture on it, it stands on its own if I need it to, and I received it very quickly in the mail.

author: Mother Beaver (Gretchen)
title: origami cover
body: When we pre-ordered our Kindle Fire HDX 8.9, my husband ordered the red cover for his.  I didn't want the black or blue cover, so I checked periodically to see if something else would become available.  When this "create your own" cover showed up, I chose one of their stock designs.  All I can say is that it's really beautiful and I've had so many complimentary comments about it.  Highly recommend.

author: Becky Pierce
title: works great
body: i like the fact that it is so easy to take the case off. the case can make it a little heave when your reading.

author: Kindle Customer
title: Very nice work
body: I am super satisfied.

author: Tiffani M. Bassett
title: Color faded...
body: I love the case, I chose a very vibrant flower picture, but it was very washed out with a lot of green. But I still love the picture.

author: N. Jennings
title: This was a birthday gift and now the entire thought of giving a gift is ruined because of this CRAP! Thanks for nothing
body: THIS IS NOT WHAT I ORDERED!!!!!!!!! I can't believe that after waiting so long and paying over $50.00 for an item it comes up to be INCORRECT!!! If you people cannot get a customised item correct, why do you advertise it?! I requested two DIFFERENT photos on the Kindle case, instead I got the same photo on both sides!!! This was a birthday gift and now the entire thought of giving a gift is ruined because of this CRAP! Thanks for nothing!!! BULLS***!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Love it !!
body: I have had this product for a couple of weeks now, and I am extremely pleased with it.  I used one of the stock patterns offered rather than a custom photo, and had it printed on the front only.  It came exactly as shown in the custom preview, even down to the pattern placement.  As others have mentioned, there is a slight tacky feel to the printing, but this wears off after a couple of days.  The printing seems very durable and I love the green floral pattern I chose.  Highly recommended if you choose one of their patterns, but based on other reviews YMMV if you try to upload a custom photo.

author: NF
title: Clever origami case but image quality not quite what's shown in preview **Updated**
body: This is basically the Amazon Kindle Fire Origami Case, but with an image added to it by Cafe Press. The process for selecting the image and creating your perfect cover is fairly painless:Step 1: Decide whether you want the image on the front, back, or both. If you select both front & back, it has to be the same image for both; you can't put a different image on each.Step 2: Select your image. Amazon has 9 "Exclusives" images, all of them various patterns, plus 30 other pattern images and 30 nature scenes. You can also browse your computer for an image you have taken or created.The one drawback to the latter is that it has to be a pretty large image. If, like me, all of your personal images have been resized for, e.g., display on Facebook, you'll find that they are too small for this process. The dialog notes, "We recommend using an image greater than 1 MB, and for best results a 2500 X 3500px or higher resolution photo shot in portrait mode." I tried it with an image that was 513 pixels high by 408 pixels wide and it was ridiculously small in the preview mode, even at maximum magnification, covering only a postage-stamp area of the case. There are options to zoom, move, and rotate your personal image but there is a limit to how much you can zoom and there is no option to tile an image.The dialog that walks you through the process has a good preview that shows you what the image will look like on the case and I had fun playing around with various options. Ultimately, I opted for a nature scene, autumn trees reflected in a pond. The image in the preview was sharp and clear, with vibrant colors; the image on the case I received in the mail less so. The colors were muted and the image not as sharp. It was still attractive but you should definitely be aware that what you see is not exactly what you will get.Step 3: Add to Cart.That's basically it. Because the image has to be attached to the case, this case won't be available in two days, even if you have Amazon Prime. In my case, it took a little over a week.As for the case itself, it's the standard Amazon Polyurethane Origami Case. The origami notion was a clever idea and it's fun to play with but I'm not totally sold on it. The case is a bit heavier than I expected, since it has a magnet to keep the case closed, magnets to lock in the origami mode when the case is open and you're using it as a stand, and magnets to hold the underside of the tablet to the case. It made me a little nervous that the tablet didn't lock into the case, as is typical of most cases but, so far, the magnets are holding the case securely in place and I've not seen any sign of slippage or any chance that it will fall out of the case.Naturally, the case supports automatically turning the tablet on when you open the case and off when you close it. Some users have reported problems with the cover folded all the way back that the tablet gets fooled by the magnets and it thinks the case is closed so it shuts down. Personally, I haven't seen this.In origami mode, the case can prop up the tablet either in landscape mode or in portrait mode. The one thing missing is that with the older generation cases, you could prop the tablet up at various angles. With the origami case, there's only one angle, although that angle appears to have been reasonably well-chosen.Overall, I give the case 3 stars. I'm taking away a star because the image quality isn't what the preview showed and because they require such a large image for personal pictures, and another star because the origami case has some quirks that take getting used to. On balance, I think I have a slight preference for the simplicity of the previous-generation cases.Update: Amazon customer 22twain, in a reply to my review of the 7" case, had a couple of great comments that I think are worth repeating. Quoting his comments:I don't do the Facebooks thing, but there is something to be said about non-destructive photo editing. As a general rule, before editing any of my personal photos, I make a copy of the originals at the native resolution and save off elsewhere in order to prevent accidental modification.Regarding the muted colors and image clarity, that's the difference between looking at an image on-screen (RGB) and the printed equivalent based on a pigment (CMYK) process. If you choose to use your own image(s), bump up the contrast, brightness and/or saturation in a photo editing program first. I use Adobe Photoshop to "tweak" my colors before sending to print, but pre-installed software on your PC/MAC can tackle the basics.

author: Bookends
title: Best Kindle Case!!!!
body: I was amazed at the professional quality of the "Create Your Own" Origami Case.  It is not a skin sticker that is put on the case, rather the image is engrained into the case.  If you are looking to customize your case unique to you, look no further.  Your design can be as unique as you are.  You also get the sturdiness and protection that the well constructed Origami provides.  I've owned every Kindle that Amazon has sold and twice as many cases, by far this is the best!

author: Bench's Best
title: personalized gift...good to great
body: I was skeptical because this cover was $5 less than standard black cover and was not sure it would be high quality.  The product and picture quality proved to be unbelievable.  It took some time to crop and center my picture but was well worth the time.  I believe the Kindle was a great mother's day gift but my wife was even more impressed with the cover that had a picture of our two boys!!

author: Kindle Customer
title: Not Living Up to the Hype
body: Was really excited about this create your own case. Loved that you could add your own picture or a stock picture to the outside.  However, did not work to hold my kindle hdx 8.9 at all!  The device would not slide all the way in.  Did not seem to fit properly.  Magnets did not hold it all.  Had to call and get a refund and will try again with another case.  Not sure if they are having ongoing quality control issues or what, but I see that the case isn't even available now.

author: Beth Cherry
title: Exactly what I was hoping for!
body: I am so happy with this purchase! The case looks great, the image came out perfectly. I was having a very frustrating time trying to find a decent Kindle Fire HDX case that wasn't leather and/or bulky, not only is this case slim, and leather free, but the fact that I was able to customize it makes this even better.
